intro: Corysanthes arcana, commonly known as the mountain orchid, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of New Guinea. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, fragrant flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil to thrive. Its unique floral structure includes a prominent lip that aids in pollination by attracting specific insect species. Corysanthes arcana is a rare and endangered species, making conservation efforts crucial for its survival.
